document.title: Georgia Performance Standards for Health Education

75DAC190DFE501312ED368A86D17958E.description: Encourage peers to make positive health choices.
comments: Draw a picture to encourage classmates to use a booster seat or wear a safety belt.
Remind students to cover their nose and mouth when they sneeze.

75DA81B0DFE501312ED268A86D17958E.description: Seek assistance to promote personal health.
comments: Request help when deciding on healthier snack options.
Ask for help when being teased at school.

75DA4080DFE501312ED168A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to advocate for personal, family, and community health.
comments: Kindergarten students will role model healthy behaviors that promote personal health and encourage positive choices in others.
Practice safety precautions used before crossing the street.
Show basic first-aid procedures for bandaging a scrape.
75D9F130DFE501312ED068A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate healthy behaviors that prevent injuries.

75D98060DFE501312ECF68A86D17958E.description: Show healthy behaviors that improve personal health and wellness.
comments: Demonstrate the correct technique for brushing teeth.
Practice stress management skills.

75D938D0DFE501312ECE68A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to practice health-enhancing behaviors and avoid or reduce health risks.
comments: Students will demonstrate the ability to practice health-enhancing behaviors and avoid or reduce health risks. Kindergarten students will name health behaviors to prevent injuries, diseases, and disorders.

75D8FAD0DFE501312ECD68A86D17958E.description: Identify family members who can assist with achieving short-term health goals.
comments: Describe how a family member can be a role model by eating healthy foods.
Role play how parents can remind children to practice healthy behaviors.
Identify several potential health goals.
Set a goal to brush your teeth three times a day every day.

75D87F20DFE501312ECB68A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: Students will use goal-setting skills to identify, apply, and maintain health-enhancing behaviors. Kindergarten students will identify personal health goals and determine who can assist them in achieving their goals.
Identify who to ask for help when you are ill at school.
Explain when someone should call 911.
75D83CE0DFE501312ECA68A86D17958E.description: Discuss when and what assistance is needed for health-related situations.

comments: Identify potential risky health situations at school.
Describe possible causes of conflict with classmates.

75D7AA80DFE501312EC868A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Students will use decision-making skills to identify, apply, and maintain health-enhancing behaviors. Kindergarten students will identify health-related situations where decision-making skills are needed.

75D76EE0DFE501312EC768A86D17958E.description: Develop listening skills to enhance health.
comments: Explain how a person with good listening skills can enhance his or her health.
Participate in a role-play to help recognize good listening skills.

75D732A0DFE501312EC668A86D17958E.description: Discuss ways to express feelings in a healthy way.
comments: Describe how to express emotions in healthy ways.
Discuss how to express feelings to prevent a conflict from starting.

75D6F580DFE501312EC568A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health and avoid or reduce health risks.
comments: Students will use effective communication skills to enhance personal, family, and community health. Kindergarten students will recognize skills needed to develop and maintain healthy personal relationships.
Identify community helpers who can assist students in understanding the safety procedures.
Discuss the people in the school who can help you when a student is being bullied.
75D6B860DFE501312EC468A86D17958E.description: Identify school and community health helpers.

75D678B0DFE501312EC368A86D17958E.description: Discuss the role of trusted adults and health professionals as sources of health information.
comments: Describe the role of a variety of health care professionals in promoting health (e.g., dentist, eye doctor).
Discuss the role of the school nurse in prompting student wellness.
Students will access valid health information and health-promoting products and services. Kindergarten students will identify trusted adults who can assist them in enhancing their health.
75D63650DFE501312EC268A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to access valid information and products and services to enhance health.

comments: Discuss how advertisements (e.g., rhymes, jingles) can influence individuals to purchase certain products.
Discuss how family, culture, and the media influence food choices.
75D5EB40DFE501312EC168A86D17958E.description: State how the media influences behaviors.

75D5AA80DFE501312EC068A86D17958E.description: Identify what the school can do to support personal health practices.
comments: Identify the kinds of healthy foods served by the school cafeteria.
Discuss the purpose for school playground rules.

75D56A30DFE501312EBF68A86D17958E.description: Explain how family influences personal health practices.
comments: Name physical activities family members can participate in together(e.g., raking leaves, walking, playing sports).
Identify family rules that promote health and safety (e.g., washing hands before meals).

75D526C0DFE501312EBE68A86D17958E.description: Students will analyze the influence of family, peers, culture, media, technology, and other factors on health behaviors.
comments: Students will analyze the influence of family, peers, culture, media, technology, and other factors on health behaviors. Kindergarten students will recognize and identify external factors that influence their personal health.

75D4E2F0DFE501312EBD68A86D17958E.description: Identify that physical health is one dimension of health and wellness.
comments: Identify that a healthy person exercises, eats well, and goes to the doctor.
Describe ways to prevent the spread of communicable diseases to promote physical health.
Identify healthy food choices.
Explain why healthy behaviors such as brushing teeth and getting adequate sleep are important.

75D44C40DFE501312EBB68A86D17958E.description: Students will comprehend concepts related to health promotion and disease prevention to enhance health.
comments: Students will acquire basic personal health concepts that help maintain healthy behaviors and prevent disease. Kindergarten students will identify healthy behaviors.
